author: deanwenick
title: Copper Seed Safe Token Plugin
description:
This proposal addresses three problems:

Increasing commerce of physical goods on Cardano.
Storing seed phrases safely and securely.
Helping independent stake pool operators attract delegators.

f6_assessments.q0: Copper Seed Safe Token Plugin proposes the idea to distribute their CSST token to SPOs who would reward delegated with that token for staking to their pools. The tokens can then be transferred back to copper seed safe team an exchanged for a copper seed safe kit to store their seed phrase. The company is already running and selling these seed phrase kits and this solution brings an open source plugin into the ecosystem for people to use to purchase the seed phrase kit with their acquired tokens. The initiative helps newcomers in a number of ways including encouraging them to stake to SPOs, getting them to pay for an item and then also to use a seed phrase solution to keep their seed phrase safe. They intend to distribute their tokens into multiple token distribution platforms which would help with the integration and usage of this token. The proposer outlines a number of risks to do with privacy, the open source plugin, the redemption program and how the token actually gets used. The risks and responses to those risks are fair and well thought out. Overall this is a very exciting proposal with a good chance to make a massive impact due to it blending together a mixture of important experiences for newcomers coming into the ecosystem whilst also providing long term potential value to those users and potentially impactful efforts towards decentralizing stake across a wider range of single pool SPOs.
f6_assessments.q1: For the plan for this proposal the progress is broken down into multiple month groupings of work. The first starts with the development of the plugin, then the distribution of the CSST to stakepools and finally the final distribution and encouragement to redeem the kits for those tokens. A simple timeline image helps to indicate where effort will be made at different stages throughout the proposals progress. The budget is broken down into the development effort for the plugin and then the prepaid amount for the 1000 copper seed phrase kits. The amounts are fair and reasonable for the execution effort needed and are sensible in terms of the amount of kits to start with. In regards to the team the copper seed safe team details are listed with the founders twitter page also included who is called Dean. Existing stake pool operator collaborations are also included such as with Stef from Rabbit Hole Pool with their stake pool information. The only missing person for this proposal is the developer for the plugin which adds a minor risk to the execution of the proposal. Overall it appears likely this proposal will be executed feasibly due to the business already being set up and running with evidence to support that and the evidence of the background of the people involved showing the right supporting skill sets to execute this proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: In terms of tracking progress the proposal outlines the delivery of keys parts of the proposal and the expected date for that to happen. A twitter page and website are provided however it would have been also good to be explicit on where any updates on the progress of this proposal will be posted for the community to audit. In terms of success the proposer mentions that this would include an open source plugin for the community to benefit from and that people get the benefits of the product with a goal to reach 1000 different people in the ecosystem. The fact that this widget will be open source for the community to use and adapt is a fantastic way in which this proposal will be both auditable and also highly valuable to the community to tweak and use for themselves. The clarity of this proposal is clear and concise on what will be delivered by the proposer and the objectives are specific against what they are trying to deliver. Although links are provided in any future proposals it will benefit voters and assessors if the proposer is explicit on where any updates will come from and also exactly where the open source code will be hosted with a Github repository.
f6_assessments.reply: Thank you for the feedback. The source code will, indeed, be shared on Github. We would also like to get it into the WordPress SVN repository. This seemed complicated to explain in the proposal and was left out. Thank you.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal is for building a WordPress plugin (among other tasks) that will enable WordPress developers to use a plug-and-play module to include the pay by ADA feature in their web apps. WordPress is said to be the most used free and open-source content management system. I remember catalyst proposals with the goal of paying for ADA plugin development( example CardanoPress). The proposer has found few plugins for ADA payment in WordPress and will use it as a base. In addition, the proposal aims to put (to be offered free of charge funded from the proposal ) a minimum of 1000 Copper Seed Safe kits and onboard single pool SPOs to offer Copper Seed Safe Tokens to attract more delegators. There are a few unanswered questions in the proposal like how will the copper seed tokens will be adding value in places other than in copper seed dApp and why should catalyst funds be used to market Copper seed safe.  However, the use of Copper seed safe and the WordPress plugin by itself can be used to justify the proposal.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal is from a joint team of Copper seed business owner Dean Wenick and a few SPOs. The lead proposer Dean Wenick is selling Copper Seed safe for approximately $14 worldwide. The site also offers the option to pay with ADA. The unique team of e-commerce business person focussing solely on Cardano and SPO provide a distinct advantage.  Dean Wenick claims to have more than 10 years of experience in WordPress development and will oversee the development of the plugin for accepting Cardano Native Assets. Proposers plan to hire plugin developers with experience in the dandelion or blockfrost APIs. Therefore with the experience and knowledge of the team, it is likely that they will be able to complete the proposal in time.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal is for $35K to be spent over a period of 9 months in three phases. $10K is for funding 1000 Copper seed safe which will be distributed to delegators who earn Copper Seed Safe tokens by delegating to pools that offer them. Overall the proposal aims to improve the visibility of Copper seed safe. The WordPress plugin work is expected to be completed in 3 months by leveraging already available plugins. $25K has been earmarked for identifying and improving the already available plugin. There is a need for more information of what is the quantum of improvement required to carry out and how many plugins are already available. This crucial piece of information is critical for the evaluation of audibility. The success of the proposal will proliferate the use of Copper seed safe and improve the state of SPOs.
f6_assessments.reply: Thank you for the thoughtful feedback. We will work on providing more quantifiable information. Thanks again.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal would be within the challenge goal, this is a great and original idea, and I think that this proposal probably will increase utility & adoption of Cardano wallet  challenge and builted for a great community (developers and consumers). At the same time the statement of how problem is to be solved is explained with a technical elements of the offered services.
The proposal want to address three problems: increasing commerce of physical goods on Cardano, storing seed phrases safely and securely and helping independent stake pool operators attract delegators.
This proposal is clear and concrete, based on Copper Seed Safe experience and they are already delivering this project..  This is ambitious proposal, because it impact on core users functionality and could improve cardano wallet adoption.
The proposal clearly articulates the contest, the problem, the challenge and how it will add value to the Cardano ecosystem and for all of the stakeholders..
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposer team is well skilled about the whole context of the project and they has already a token program: SPOs can provide a token (CSST) to people who delegate their ADA. and they are active members in Catalyst.
The scope of the solution is well explained (e.g. how the funds will be spent, what features will be implemented, and so on…). 
The plan for implementation is specific and offers much detail into the technical aspects like architecture, language and technologies for the implementation. The proposers have also mentioned some potential challenges and how they plan on solving them.
The budget requested is good related to a 75% on software development and 25% to purchase 1,000 Copper Seed Safe kits.
f6_assessments.q2:
Success criteria is simple to identify and trace with key metrics to measure the success by tracking the milestone and tangibly verified since we are building an open source repository.
I think that the successes and metrics are qualitative verifiable and there are quantitative KPIs (eg. Number of SPO’s with distribuited tokens…)
The proposal offers a timetable to complete the work. The proposer hasn’t considered challenges and risks relevant to a successful adoption.
f6_assessments.reply: Thank you for the thoughtful feedback.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal essentially consists of 3 main objectives: extending existing payment plugins to enable various Cardano native tokens, giving SPOs an opportunity to attract delegators by offering ISPOs and pushing the personal business of the main proposer. While in my opinion the latter point is actually not something that needs to be funded by catalyst funds, the first two objectives are sure very worthwhile and very much in the sense of Cardanos mission by supporting decentralisation and commercial adaption and also by providing some more utility to other native tokens. Hence, I think this will be beneficial to the Cardano ecosystem. Also, in my opinion the proposal should be able to scale.
f6_assessments.q1:
What is good in the implementation plan: The proposers are transparent about themselves and their already existing work. Some milestones exist that define some tasks that make sense in the larger picture and enable to see what will be done and when. The commitment to Open Source is very commendable. Also, some risk and contigency discussions have been made that catch some of the possible hurdles.
What could be improved regarding feasibility: The responsible person for the main task, the developer, has not yet been found. Also, the development process is not really defined in detail yet. While the proposer correctly says that said payment plugins already exist and only need to be modified to accept other tokens, the process in which this is done and the amount of time and development steps needing to be done are not defined, thus making it difficult to at the same time accept a lump sum of 25k as a well-justified budget. These points could be defined better and also those parts of the roadmap made with more detail.
f6_assessments.q2: Despite some of those imperfections, the proposal should be auditable: All the deliverables and goals defined seem very tangible, and if doccumented correctly could be available to users. The open source character off course would also help increase auditability. Only think I am missing at the moment is a github or similar platform tobe able to track the Open Source development process and also to access the code later when finished. Excpect for that, a job well done regarding auditability.
f6_assessments.reply: Thank you for taking the time to evaluate this.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal sort of merges 2 concepts into 1 package, which are an ISO (initial stakepool offer) that rewards delegators of independent stake pools with tokens that can be exchanged for a physical copper plates to record their wallet seed phrases for safe keeping, and secondly, the development of a plugin which will allow acceptance of Cardano for the purchase of physical goods on wordpress websites.

The proposal does clearly articulate a solution to maintaining decentralization which is valid, by promoting independent stakepool operators.  In doing so, the proposal introduces a product, used in this case as a reward for delegators, based on the discretionary distribution of the rights to those rewards by stakepool operators themselves.  That product is also for sale, hence the additional element of allowing it's outright purchase using a custom designed plugin - even though the details of how it operates are not 100% clear.

Overall, the project uses the recurring sale of the physical item, which is pretty cool, as a sustainability element.  And in that regard, as well as the compatibility of Cardano in the purchase process, the proposal seems to be appropriately located in the Dapps, Products, and Integrations challenge.
f6_assessments.q1:
My neutrality on feasibility for this proposals is partly due to a lack of any identity or relevant experience from the proposal team.  There is a Twitter profile posted for Dean Wenick in the links section, a self described photographer and founder of Copper Seed Safe last year.

As it goes on, the budget breakdown provided in the feasibility section is basic, and results in 2 core questions:  1) Does this proposal team have the necessary skills do execute the technical requirements? - the development costs for example have no breakdown in terms of time or team members, and  2) Did he factor shipping into the cost of the 1000 copper seed kits he plan to send around the world? - 10x1000=10,000, however there is no budget allocation for shipping costs even-though rates are quickly rising.

Beyond the concerns mentioned above, the proposal does touch on necessary resources, but stops short of explaining clear plans for implementation of technical feats.  Successful implementation also depends on the buy-in from SPOs, and that could be a challenge as the volume of projects increases.

As proposer discusses risks, he reveals that he does indeed have years of experience as a WordPress developer, although security risks as they relate to the technical requirements of launching a Woocommerce plugin are likely beyond his understanding.   The lack of depth in these central risks to the projects delivery and usability limits my evaluation of the feasibility at the stage where only the proposer himself is responsible for delivery if this project is funded.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposer presents a clear roadmap with milestones for delivery of this project, in which he sets a goal for all of the CSST ISO tokens to be distributed on an 8 month timeline.

While he doesn't directly define the impact to stakepool delegation distribution with this project, he does set targets from which we will be able to observe if there is traction.  And in this case of supporting attractive independent stakepool selection, it's kind of something we just need to evaluate over time, but projects like this help.

Finally, as a suggestion to the proposer, there was no open source channel proposed for the coding or availability of the plugin.  I wasn't clear what the plan was to make it available, but doing so would be a benefit to other projects that want to follow your lead without doubling up on resources to accomplish it.
f6_assessments.reply: This is a fair and constructive critique. Thank you for taking the time with it.

f6_assessments.q0: For a well written proposal that clearly outlines 3 creative impacts to the Cardano ecosystem, I rank this section a 4. This proposal presents an existing business with increased developments that could have positive benefits on the Cardano ecosystem. This proposal doesn’t come off to me as one that comes with a lot of tangible risks but it does thoroughly assess a variety of risks and how the proposer intends to react/prepare. This tells me that the proposer has thoroughly “stress tested” this idea and is prepared for various circumstances. I agree with this sections assessment that this proposal effectively increases the utility of ADA by adding/proliferating this businesses product as a purchasable item. While I do feel like this product is on the expensive side, I do very much like the idea of proliferating a culture of security within the Cardano ecosystem to create a more safe environment. What I feel like I’m missing from this section of the proposal is a quantifiable outlook of the impact that justifies a $35k price tag (which is relatively average for many Catalyst proposals). I’d imagine this could be relatively hard to do with cryptocurrency being such a new industry, I think this would push me into ranking this section a 5 and it would leave voters with a metric they can confidently respond positively to.
f6_assessments.q1: I rank this section a 4 for clearly defined deliverability and demonstrated capable experience. This proposal safely diversifies its feasibility because it has two routes of deliverability that will still provide some impacts if the other fails. The first route is the copper seed safe business that puts security tools in the hands of Cardano community members. The second route is the WordPress plugin that will enable ADA and CNT assets to purchase said products that delivers additional utility to the Cardano ecosystem. The second route is a little immeasurable because it appears that this team member has yet to be onboarded but I’m rather enthusiastic about this teams capability to find such a person (shown by their reputability). The roadmap looks reasonably outlined for a deliverable outcome but the budget could use some additional detailing. With the category breakdown that we’re given, voters are not enabled the ability to properly evaluate spending efficiency. The best proposals breakdown hours of labor, specific spending details, and hourly rates, all of which would substantially improve this section from a 4 to a 5.
f6_assessments.q2: This section successfully provides a rank 5 top-tier auditiblity section with thorough outline of milestone based metrics at different timelines, a clearly quantified definition of success, and all with concise organization. The only thing that I feel like I’m missing from this section (and this proposal) is the greater marketing strategy for increased awareness of this product. I think voters would appreciate a dedication to performance in social media engagement and community awareness. Still, this section is clearly aiming at specific KPIs and has a timeframe for accomplishing those goals, which is exactly what the best Catalyst proposals do.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal is actually addressing all three areas of the challenge it is placed in:

- Decentralized apps: 
Copperseedsafe.com website is a dAPP that Cardano wallets connect to to unlock exclusive features. This program will provide extended tools for more projects to implement 

- Physical products:
A physical copy of a seed phrase on metal is permanent. It is one of the few places where the physical world meets the blockchain. 

- Integration:
This program integrates existing token claiming systems with the physical world via the Copper Seed Safe product. This adds a valuable incentive for people to participate in the network by staking their ADA, and thus become more fully integrated into the ecosystem and the Cardano Community.

This proposal effectively addresses the full and complete challenge that it is found in.
f6_assessments.q1:
Dean Wenick, the proposer already has a website located at https://copperseedsafe.com/ where you can currently purchase a Copper Seed Safe.  Furthermore it is already a Dapp and you can already connect your Cardano wallet to the website. In addition to this you can head over to https://taptools.io/ to pick up a Copper Seed Safe Token, and once you have done this and have it in your wallet, you can access the hidden part of the website only open to those with the token.

The physical product already exists, the token already exists, but what is lacking is software consultations, design, and development, as well as purchasing enough of the kits to make it available to SPO's and xSPO's.

With the knowledge and background of Dean Wenick, this should easily be feasible. Dean has worked in web design and development for the past 10 years. He is very experienced with WordPress and successful with Cardano integration with WordPress and WooCommerce. He will oversee the development of the plugin for accepting Cardano Native Assets.

The feasibility is 100%, but it will heavily depend on marketing and getting SPO's and xSPO's to get involved in it. There is incentive for the SPO's and xSPO's in that offering the Copper Seed Safe token could be an incentive for people to become delegators to these pools. 

With the roadmap (milestones) laid out in this proposal, it will be feasible to complete this project. They have laid out a very detailed timeline with key milestones along the way which will be achievable easily for this proposal.  The proposer has also calculated the risks involved from things like a word press plugin which will be needed for the success of the proposal. 

I would have liked to have seen the proposer having already been actively involved in finding a good plugin developer and had a list of names and links available for us to take a look at to determine how successful the development of the plugin would be, but other then that, I would say  it is highly likely this proposal will be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposer has laid out 6 metrics to track the progress of this project once it has the funding it needs. These 6 metrics make it very simple to track how far along the project has come, where it is in its development, and even details what they completed projected would look like and the end result of it. 

The best part is that once this project is completed, Cardano will have an open source plugin, available from a public repository, that is configurable by the user to accept different Cardano Native Tokens. The plugin will be a WooCommerce payment method, and at the same time 1,000 Copper seed safe kits in the hands of ADA holders. 

Further more, because of the way this is being developed, it has the added bonus of helping to decentralize Cardano even more because it is going through SPO's and extremely small SPO's (xSPO's).
f6_assessments.reply: Thank you! We look forward to delivering this to the community!

f6_assessments.q0: This idea aims to expand existing progams to solve three problems simultaneously: Increasing commerce of physical goods on Cardano; storing seed phrases safely and securely with a physical product and helping independent stake pool operators attract delegators with unique, valuable incentives. The author did a great job on presenting this idea. They have specific solutions for each problems above with clear details about how this would work. But it would be better if the proposer included information about the target audience and ways to attract them. This idea closely matched with the challenge. I do believe that if successful, this project would bring a lot of benefit to the Cardano systems. I appreciate that the team forsaw several risks that could stand in the way of delivering this. The clear mitigation plan for each one helps to persuade that those would be effectively solved.
f6_assessments.q1: This project takes eight months to complete. The author provided a three-phase plan, but the tasks in each period are quite vague. I expected to see more specific roadmap and milestones. On the financial breakdown, there are two main items. However it is not clear enough. The proposer should have provided details in each item. For example, I undertand that 25000 USD would go for  software consultations, design, and development, but how it is spent is what I concern. Clearer information would give us better understanding of the budget breakdown to assess. The team involved here is incomplete. With the present staff, it would be better if we got to know more about them such as their backgound or related experience.
f6_assessments.q2: This auditability seems very good. We have six metrics provided which could serve as the standard to keep track the project's progress. All those KPIs are clear and measurable. Each of them has a specific deadline to complete. The success picture is ideal and achievable. The proposer presented a vision  and also four specifc metrics to assess whether this project is successful or not. Those would make it easier to imagine.
f6_assessments.reply: This is a fair and helpful assessment. Thank you very much!

solution: Expand the Copper Seed Safe token program with new open-source plugin: Stake pool operators reward delegators with tokens; tokens are exchanged for Copper Seed Safe kits; kits are mailed worldwide.
experience: I founded Copper Seed Safe in 2021. I make all kits by hand and have successfully shipped to five continents. I also designed and developed the website, which uses Mercury and CardanoPress plugins to accept ADA for payment and facilitate a token-gated sales and promotions page.
